body:
Regarding the lock, that's my point - you're can still get the lock errors, you're just reducing the load. What we should do is handle the error properly - I'm assuming it's a lock wait timeout error? Also what is your lock timeout value? The default is 50 seconds - I'm guessing you've got yours set to something like 1 or 2 seconds?

Regarding whether to compare marshalled or unmarshalled data, remember that Object#== will return false for different instances so if you have a object in the session which doesn't override == then unmarshalling the data again will create a new instance and make original_data == data false even if nothing has changed.
